abstract: The company that will be spun off, to be called Zoetis, has about $4.2 billion in annual revenue and could be valued at $15 billion or more.
snippet: The company that will be spun off, to be called Zoetis, has about $4.2 billion in annual revenue and could be valued at $15 billion or more.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer‘s animal health unit on Monday filed to sell a 20 percent stake to the public in an initial public offering.

headline.main: Pfizer Animal Health Unit Files for I.P.O.
